{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3422085,"name":"Justin Spurlock","username":"Snake51","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T16:52:32.806Z","cooked":"

I had working drivetrain code for a raptor drive robot and i wanted to add a slew rate limiter that would make the acceleration gradual but not effect deceleration after i edited the code I deployed to the robot now every time i enable the robot starts to move uncontrollably heres the code

package frc.robot;

import edu.wpi.first.math.filter.SlewRateLimiter;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.XboxController;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.drive.DifferentialDrive;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.MotorController;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.motorcontrol.Spark;
import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.smartdashboard.SmartDashboard;

/**

  • The VM is configured to automatically run this class, and to call the functions corresponding to

  • each mode, as described in the TimedRobot documentation. If you change the name of this class or

  • the package after creating this project, you must also update the build.gradle file in the

  • project.
    /
    public class Robot extends TimedRobot {
    private DifferentialDrive Drivetrain;
    private XboxController m_stick;
    private final MotorController m_leftmotor = new Spark(1);
    private final MotorController m_rightmotor = new Spark(2);
    private final MotorController m_trajectory = new Spark(3);
    private SlewRateLimiter DontRunPeopleOver = new SlewRateLimiter(1, 0, 0);
    private SlewRateLimiter DontTurnPeopleOver = new SlewRateLimiter(1);
    /    *

    • This function is run when the robot is first started up and should be used for any
    • initialization code.
      */
      @Override
      public void robotInit() {
      m_rightmotor.setInverted(true);

    Drivetrain = new DifferentialDrive(m_leftmotor, m_rightmotor);
    m_stick = new XboxController(0);
    }
    /**

    • This function is called every 20 ms, no matter the mode. Use this for items like diagnostics
    • that you want ran during disabled, autonomous, teleoperated and test.

    • This runs after the mode specific periodic functions, but before LiveWindow and

    • SmartDashboard integrated updating.
      */
      @Override
      public void robotPeriodic() {}

/** This function is called once when teleop is enabled. */
@Override
public void teleopInit() {}

/** This function is called periodically during operator control. */
@Override
public void teleopPeriodic() {

double turnspeed;
double speed;
double Maxspeed = 0.2;

turnspeed = m_stick.getRightX();
speed = m_stick.getLeftY();
if (turnspeed > Maxspeed)
  turnspeed = Maxspeed;
if (turnspeed < -Maxspeed)
  turnspeed = -Maxspeed;
if (speed < -Maxspeed)
  speed = -Maxspeed;

speed = DontRunPeopleOver.calculate(speed);
turnspeed = DontTurnPeopleOver.calculate(turnspeed);

SmartDashboard.putNumber("turnspeed", turnspeed);
SmartDashboard.putNumber("forwardspeed", speed);

Drivetrain.arcadeDrive(-speed, -turnspeed);
 if(m_stick.getRawButton(2))
  {
    m_trajectory.set(1);
  }
else
{
  if(m_stick.getRawButton(1))
    {
      m_trajectory.set(-1);
    }    
else
 {
  m_trajectory.set(0);
 }
}

}

Snake51:

i wanted to add a slew rate limiter that would make the acceleration gradual but not effect deceleration

Snake51:

private SlewRateLimiter DontRunPeopleOver = new SlewRateLimiter(1, 0, 0);

I think you should use something like -100 for the negative rate limit. A rate limit of zero is not helpful as it prevents changes in that direction. See SlewRateLimiter.calculate.

I prefer to think of rate limits in terms of their inverse: the time for one unit change. Here a rate of zero leads to infinite time. My rule of thumb for rate limits is to use times as high as we can without the drivers complaining. Empirically this seems to be somewhere around 0.1–0.25s. See Ramps.

i have made the change but am unable to try it out

is this also the cause of the robot moving when enabled without the joystick telling it to?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T19:08:35.905Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470963,"topic_slug":"help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke","display_username":"Justin Spurlock","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":38743,"username":"bovlb","name":"Gavin Matthews","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57508,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Snake51"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke/470963/3","custom_user_title":"Snake51","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3422138,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T19:13:53.816Z","cooked":"
Snake51:

is this also the cause of the robot moving when enabled without the joystick telling it to?

It might contribute, but that suggests something else is going on. Consider using deadband on your control input. See MathUtil.applyDeadband. You might like to try a value in the range 0.05–0.2.

// Ignore small values and rescale 
speed = MathUtil.ApplyDeadband(speed, 0.05);

Consider also investing in more expensive game controllers, which will be less noisy and hence require smaller deadband.

This won’t fix your current problem, but eventually you may want to rescale the joystick response to be non-linear. For example:

// Raise speed to a power, preserving sign
speed = Math.pow(Math.abs(speed), 2.3) * Math.signum(speed);
","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T20:03:31.788Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470963,"topic_slug":"help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":4,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/math/MathUtil.html#applyDeadband(double,double)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MathUtil (WPILib API 2024.3.2)","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke/470963/4","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3422158,"name":"Justin Spurlock","username":"Snake51","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T20:23:40.076Z","cooked":"

I doubt that the problem was caused by the controller i had thought that may be it but checked driver station before enabling and all the inputs were within a hundreth of being 0 and even if it was because of that the treads were moving at an intense speed most likely full throttle

its almost certainly the controller - those hundredths are visible but the actual value changes hundreds of times per second, and you may not see spikes that go into the tenths

use a deadband!

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-09T21:00:37.164Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":41,"readers_count":40,"score":8.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":470963,"topic_slug":"help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57508,"username":"Snake51","name":"Justin Spurlock","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/90ced4/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-code-adding-a-slew-rate-limiter-and-is-broke/470963/6","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3422167,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-09T21:00:12.253Z","cooked":"

I would expect that SlewRateLimiter.calculate with a zero negative rate limit would stick at the highest positive speed commanded and not go down (a speed ratchet). I would not expect it to ramp up to a high speed in the absence of joystick input, although a noisy joystick would give it some input.
